fullplot: This film, which is basically the longest narrative film ever made, is a 15-1/2 hour episodic exploration of the character of Franz Biberkopf, "hero" of Alfred Dèblin's acclaimed novel, as well as the Alexanderplatz area of Berlin that he inhabits.
plot: In late-1920s Berlin, Franz Biberkopf is released from prison and vows to go straight; however he soon finds himself embroiled in the city's criminal underworld.
title: Berlin Alexanderplatz
